Known as the leading pioneer in the creation of Neurohop, Caliber Music has quickly become a byword for cutting edge experimental bass music. After a bumper schedule featuring a slew of massive releases, the US based label takes a lookback with the 'Let's Call It Neurohop' LP: Volume One. A call to arms from some of the most innovative producers in the game, Caliber's latest project features 10 tracks of the most cutting edge music - including favorites from the likes of MakO, Vexisle, and Haywyre to name only a few. Featuring styles ranging from the twisted, metallic sounds of Disprove's 'Gear Bot', the slick, jazz tinged flair of Haywyre's 'Prototype' and the retro funk swing of Myselor's "It Don't Mean A Thing', "Let's Call It Neurohop" LP: Volume One represents the best of a label determined to break the mould. Quality over quantity.
